metadata.synopsis: Tara rejoins Gale, offering him a magic item and reminding him of his plight.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Use Companion debug Book(Ctrl+Shift+7)Gale> Act 1 > Tara the Tressym

31.speaker: Narrator
31.text: *Sleep is a hazy oasis on the far side of a desert of worry.*
31.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale is lying restless on his bedroll, unable to sleep

25.speaker: Narrator
25.text: *You know exactly what this illithid parasite will do to you. Within seven days, you'll become a mind flayer.*

49.speaker: Narrator
49.text: *But what about the bomb in your chest? Ceremorphosis is likely to destabilise it. What then?*

43.speaker: Gale
43.text: Consider that it'll explode, flattening an area larger than Waterdeep.

34.speaker: Narrator
34.text: *You try to think of something else but it's no good.*

16.speaker: Narrator
16.text: *You imagine the explosion. Thousands will die. You have to stop it - ceremorphosis and the orb itself.*

46.speaker: Gale
46.text: Think of Mystra, goddess of magic.

53.speaker: Narrator
53.text: *She was furious when she realised what you'd done. Seeking control, trying to prove yourself her equal. You were in love with her. Now you're a danger to everyone you know.*

15.speaker: Narrator
15.text: *Your mistakes have been huge. The consequences... memorable. But you won't let anyone die. You can't.*

10.speaker: Narrator
10.text: *You'll need to drain magical energy from a powerful artefact soon. As you contemplate your hubris, your eyelids grow heavier and heavier...*
10.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] Fade to black. Gale falls asleep.NodeContext: GAle falling asleep toward the end, can be stretched out a little

48.speaker: Tara the Tressym
48.text: Excuse me, Mr Dekarios. Mr Dekarios. Yoo-hoo!
48.context: CinematicNodeContext: The dialogue opens to a black screen on a camp morning. We hear Tara's voice through the blackness.

51.speaker: Tara the Tressym
51.text: Destiny is at your door; won't you at least twitch the curtain?
51.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] Gale startles awake and jumps to his feet, revealing a winged cat perched on an object (stump? chair? whatever will help Tara be at Gale's eye-level while he's standing. The idea is that their dialogue will be cheap from here on out, i.e. Gale won't have to talk and emote while sitting or laying down, but standing in normal position).

17.speaker: Tara the Tressym
17.text: Well, it isn't the Mother of All Magic, lucky for you. You look terrible. Are you eating?

47.speaker: Gale
47.text: I can look after myself, Tara.

29.speaker: Tara the Tressym
29.text: I have my doubts. But first things first...

28.speaker: Gale
28.text: Goodness, I'd forgotten. Thank the gods you reminded me before I starved to death.

32.speaker: Tara the Tressym
32.text: I won't be teased, heckled, pestered, or vexed, Mr Dekarios. Not before I've had my due.

42.speaker: Gale
42.text: In fact, I think I feel as bad as I look.

2.speaker: Tara the Tressym
2.text: No matter, Mr Dekarios. Tara's here now, and she'll sort you out. But first, my payment.

26.speaker: Tara the Tressym
26.text: Ahhh, that's it. No one manages the nuances quite like you.
26.context: CinematicNodeContext: She approaches Gale. He smiles,bends and scratches her around the neck. "Ahh, that's it..." At the end of the line, she returns to her neutral pose.

33.speaker: Gale
33.text: Dare I ask what you're doing here?

22.speaker: Tara the Tressym
22.text: Making sure you keep on the straight and narrow, as is my task in this weary life.

4.speaker: Tara the Tressym
4.text: I looked away for a moment, just once, and look where it got us. You, a living doomsday device. The shame.
4.context: NodeContext: (She says this with an undertone of affection).

9.speaker: Narrator
9.text: *Nestled amongst your books and papers, Tara bore witness to your greatest triumphs... and your greatest failure.*

8.speaker: Narrator
8.text: *You made yourself a walking cataclysm, the annihilation brewing within you just about held at bay by your constant consumption of magical objects. Tara saw it all, but never left your side.*

11.speaker: Tara the Tressym
11.text: Speaking of which - I brought you something. For your tummy troubles.
11.context: CinematicNodeContext: Magic pocket - Tara teleport's an object into Gale's pocket.

19.speaker: Narrator
19.text: *A ring, coursing with magic. The Netherese orb within you shudders, longing to consume, to devour... It must be satisfied.*

24.speaker: Tara the Tressym
24.text: We have a great deal of catching up to do. Eat that, have a wash and, for the love of all that's dear, a shave. Then you can fill me in on what I've missed.

45.speaker: Gale
45.text: Thank you, Tara. I really needed this.

6.speaker: Tara the Tressym
6.text: Of course, Mr Dekarios. What else are friends for?

20.speaker: Tara the Tressym
20.text: Now eat up! If you explode and kill us all, I'll be furious.

21.speaker: Gale
21.text: I'm not sure, Tara. It's dangerous out here.

0.speaker: Tara the Tressym
0.text: All the more reason I ought to be looking after you.

35.speaker: Tara the Tressym
35.text: Anyway - incidentally - I was getting very bored without my friend.

44.speaker: Tara the Tressym
44.text: Handy little spell I've been working on. 'Tara's Catflap of Displacement.' I haven't worked out all the kinks, but I'm starting to be able to find my way around.

14.speaker: Tara the Tressym
14.text: It is terribly good to see you, Mr Dekarios.

39.speaker: Gale
39.text: You need to go home - now. And that's final.

7.speaker: Tara the Tressym
7.text: I don't take orders from my masseuse. Eat up, now. And chat soon.

12.speaker: Gale
12.text: It's good to see you, Tara. I've missed you very much.

13.speaker: Tara the Tressym
13.text: And I you, of course. The tower just isn't the same without you stomping about in the background.

1.speaker: Tara the Tressym
1.text: So here I am, come to re-insert myself. After all, remember what happened last time I let you out of sight?

50.speaker: Tara the Tressym
50.text: Of course you do. You're still paying the price with that ticking time bomb in your gullet. Ugh, the indignity.

52.speaker: Gale
52.text: Don't get used to it. You need to go back to Waterdeep. Now.

41.speaker: Tara the Tressym
41.text: Wizards ask questions, they don't issue imperatives. You ought to know that by now, Mr Dekarios.

54.speaker: Tara the Tressym
54.text: But I suppose your case is worse than I thought. All the more reason for me to stay and keep an eye on things. We wouldn't want you to make another apocalyptic mistake, would we?

36.speaker: Gale
36.text: Well, well, well. Look what the tressym dragged in.

27.speaker: Tara the Tressym
27.text: I know, I'm looking exceptionally well. You, on the other hand - how the tidy have fallen. Are you eating?

18.speaker: Gale
18.text: You promised to stay in Waterdeep. 'Promise,' verb, meaning to swear something will or will not be done.

3.speaker: Tara the Tressym
3.text: And I decided 'will not'. And a good thing, too. You look like you haven't had a good meal in days.
3.context: NodeContext: With mother hennish but irritated concern.
